ygData.subject: RE: Missing bard songs (was Updated Song Analysis 21+)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... the ... You d be bitter playing just about any class then.  Almost every class is unfinished .  There are many spells and skills that were never
ygData.messageBody:
> Date: Tue, 9 Nov 1999 13:52:19 -0700
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> Subject: RE: Missing bard songs (was Updated Song Analysis 21+)
>
> Pardon me if I sound bitter or doubtful, but when 6 months after release
the
> bard class is still unfinished I think I have cause to be.

You'd be bitter playing just about any class then. Almost every class is
"unfinished". There are many spells and skills that were never implemented
or useless. For example many classes have the Sense Magic spell, which has
no use at all. And what about the poor Rogues? They are much worse off
than Bards.

Brad has stated numerous times that EQ is a work in progress. If you are
going to be bitter about the unfinished parts, either suck it up and live
with it or quit EQ.

> I still greatly doubt that a high level binding
> song would be unbalancing. Given the lack of knowledge other classes
have
> about bards, if it was self only most people would never even know it
> existed.

Haha. Kitasi, I thought you said the ability to bind was one of the most
important abilities in the game. How could giving Bind to Bards not be
unbalancing?


Wayne
